last st to first with a slip_stitch 24sts round 9^^ decrease around join last st to first with a slip_stitch 12sts ^^feel free at this stage to work decrease around once more taking your stitch count down to 6sts for round 10 before fastening off i found that the hole was small enough for my gauge at 12sts to close but you may feel it best to reduce further depending on your own personal gauge fasten_off leaving a tail use the tail to weave in and out of the remaining stitches pull tight and close the hole hide loose end pompom i used this video tutorial to make my extra large pompom remember to leave a tail for sewing the pompom to the centre of your hat at the top if you d prefer a smaller pompom here s a video tutorial showing an effective way to make a proportionally sized pompom suitable for a weebee doll hat 0101010 skinny scarf row 1 taking your chosen colour for the ends of the scarf i used red ch5 work a half_double_crochet in second chain from hook half_double_crochet in each of the remaining 3chs turn 4sts row 2-4 ch1 not a st from now on half_double_crochet in each st across turn 4sts change to main scarf colour i used teal … rnds 5-46^^ ch1 half_double_crochet in each st across turn 4sts ^^feel free to work more or less row at this point for a longer or shorter scarf change to end scarf colour i used red … rnds 47-50 ch1 half_double_crochet in each st across turn 4sts fasten_off and hide loose ends 0101010 cosy mitten make 2 mittens are worked in joined rounds at the end of each round join the last st to the first with a slip_stitch round 1 using chosen colour i used red magic_ring ch1 not a st from now on and work 7hdc join as above 7sts round 2 ch1 and work 2hdc into each st around join 14sts round 3 ch1 half_double_crochet into each st around join 14sts round 4 ch1 work a 4dc bobble see special stitches into the first st makes thumb half_double_crochet in each remaining st
